review.title: Class Imbalance Problem in Data Mining Review
review.abstract: In last few years there are major changes and evolution has been done on classification of data. As the application area of technology is increases the size of data also increases. Classification of data becomes difficult because of unbounded size and imbalance nature of data. Class imbalance problem become greatest issue in data mining. Imbalance problem occur where one of the two classes having more sample than other classes. The most of algorithm are more focusing on classification of major sample while ignoring or misclassifying minority sample. The minority samples are those that rarely occur but very important. There are different methods available for classification of imbalance data set which is divided into three main categories, the algorithmic approach, data-preprocessing approach and feature selection approach. Each of this technique has their own advantages and disadvantages. In this paper systematic study of each approach is define which gives the right direction for research in class imbalance problem.

metadata.title: Class Imbalance Problem in Data Mining: Review

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: A data set that is greatly distorted when the sample of one class is higher than that of others [1]. Applications such as predicting a rare but important disease are very important than regular treatment. Similar situations are observed in other areas, such as detecting network interference [10], managing risks and predicting errors in technical devices. In such a situation, most of the classifiers are distorted and show very poor classification rates in relation to smaller classes.

sections.heading: 3. Related work

sections.heading: 4. Discussion
sections.text: Many areas are affected by class imbalance problems, and the solution offered by many techniques in data mining is helpful but not sufficient; the consideration of which technique is best suited to dealing with a problem of data distribution depends greatly on the nature of the data used for experiments.

sections.heading: 5. Conclusion
sections.text: In practice, it is reported that data preprocessing offers a better solution than other methods because it allows the addition of new information or the deletion of redundant information, which helps balance the data. Another method that is helpful to solve the problem of class imbalance is boosting. Boosting is a powerful ensemble learning algorithm that improves the performance of the weak classifier. An algorithm such as RUSBoost, SMOTEBoost is an example of increasing the algorithm. The method of feature selection can also be used to classify imbalance data. The performance of a feature selection algorithm depends on the nature of the problem. Finally, this paper suggests that the use of two or more techniques, i.e. a hybrid approach, provides a better solution to the problem of class imbalance.
